meanings.definition: A bacterial disease that is characterized by fever and swelling of the lymph glands.
meanings.sent1: Tularemias can cause fever and swollen glands.
meanings.sent2: The doctor diagnosed the patient with tularemias after observing the symptoms.
meanings.sent3: The tularemias outbreak led to a rush for medical help.
meanings.sent4: In the town, tularemias spread like wildfire, affecting many residents.
meanings.sent5: The image of tularemias attacking the body stayed in his mind.

meanings.definition: An infectious disease caused by the bacterium Francisella tularensis, transmitted to humans from infected animals.
meanings.sent1: She contracted tularemias from handling infected animals.
meanings.sent2: The researchers studied the transmission of tularemias from animals to humans.
meanings.sent3: The tularemias scare prompted people to avoid contact with wildlife.
meanings.sent4: The fear of tularemias lurking in the forest made them cautious.
meanings.sent5: The news report highlighted the dangers of tularemias spreading through animal contact.
